note: The number of confirmed cases is lower than the number of actual cases; the main reason for that is limited testing.
title: Economic decline in the second quarter of 2020 vs. confirmed COVID-19 cases per million people

xAxis.label: GDP growth from previous year, 2020 Q2

subtitle: The vertical axis shows the number of confirmed COVID-19 cases per million, as of August 30. The horizontal axis shows the percentage decline of GDP relative to the same quarter in 2019. It is adjusted for inflation.
sourceDesc: WHO COVID-19 Dashboard; Eurostat, OECD and individual national statistics agencies
